AverageCharWidth.summary: Gets the average character width using the first selector element font.

Round.summary: Rounds and truncates to the provided place value.
Round.param: The number of decimal place values.

SelectorStyle.summary: Gets the first matching selector ComputedStyle property.

HasElements.summary: Checks if an array has elements.
HasElements.returns: true if an array and it has elements; otherwise false.

HasElementValue.summary: Checks if an element has a value.
HasElementValue.returns: true if the element has content; otherwise false.

HasText.summary: Checks if the text has a value.
HasText.returns: true if the text has other than white space; otherwise false.

IsBackTab.summary: Checks keydown for a Backtab key.
IsBackTab.returns: true if a backtab; otherwise false.

IsNumber.summary: Checks if the text is a number.
IsNumber.returns: true if a number; otherwise false.

IsShiftOnly.summary: Checks keydown for only a Shift key.
IsShiftOnly.returns: true if only a Shift key; otherwise false.

IsSimpleType.summary: Checks if the value is a primitive type.
IsSimpleType.returns: true if a simple type; otherwise false.

IsString.summary: Checks if the value is a string.
IsString.returns: true if a string; otherwise false.

IsTab.summary: Checks keydown for a Tab key.
IsTab.returns: true if a Tab; otherwise false.

GetText.code: // Gets the element text. GetText() { testDiv.innerText = "X"; let result = LJC.GetText("testDiv"); // result: // "X"; testDiv.innerText = ""; result = LJC.GetText("testDiv"); // result: // ""; }

GetValue.code:
<body>
        <input type="text" id="targetInput">
      </body>

      // Gets the input element value.
      GetValue()
      {
        targetInput.value = "X";
        let result = LJC.GetValue("targetInput");
        
        // result:
        // "X";

        targetInput.value = "";
        result = LJC.GetValue("targetInput");
        
        // result:
        // "";
      }

SetText.code: // Sets the element text. SetText() { LJC.SetText("testDiv", "X"); let result = LJC.GetText("testDiv"); // result: // "X"; LJC.SetText("testDiv", ""); result = LJC.GetText("testDiv"); // result: // ""; }

SetValue.code:
<body>
        <input type="text" id="targetInput">
      </body>

      // Sets the input element value.
      SetValue()
      {
        const elementID = "targetInput";
        LJC.SetValue(elementID, "X");
        let result = LJC.GetValue(elementID);
        
        // result:
        // "X";

        LJC.SetValue(elementID, "");
        result = LJC.GetValue(elementID);
        
        // result:
        // "";
      }

EventTextRows.summary: Sets the textarea rows for newlines.

GetTextCols.param: The number of units by which to divide the width.

SetTextRows.summary: Sets the textarea rows for newlines.

BinarySearch.summary: Returns the index of a search item in the array.
BinarySearch.param: Indicates if an alert should be displayed on an error.
BinarySearch.returns: The index of the matching item.

MiddlePosition.summary: Returns the middle position of the count value.

CreateJSON.summary: Creates JSON from the provided value.

Message.param: The text dialog element ID name.
The text area element ID name.
Message.code:
<body> <!-- The dialog for debug or other display text. --> <dialog id="textDialog" style="border: none; padding: 0px"> <textarea id="textArea" rows="25" cols="80" autocorrect="off" autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly style="border: none; padding: 10px"> </textarea> </dialog> </body>
// Shows the service message. Message() { const location = LJC.Location("Class", "Method()", "textValue"); const textValue = "This is some text shown in a "textarea"" + " dialog to display more text than allowed by an alert message" + " and to allow the copy to clipboard function." + "
Text that starts with ""ServiceName":"," + " "delete", "insert", "select" or "update" will not display" + " unless the "force" parameter is set to "true"." + "
An alert dialog is displayed if the textDialogID or textAreaID" + " parameters are null." + "
Use the Escape [ESC] key to exit the dialog." const force = false; const textDialogID = "textDialog"; const textAreaID = "textArea"; LJC.Message(location, textValue, force, textDialogID, textAreaID); }

ShowText.param: The text dialog element ID name.
ShowText.code:
<body>
        <!-- The dialog for debug or other display text. -->
        <dialog id="textDialog"
          style="border: none; padding: 0px">
          <textarea id="textArea" rows="25" cols="80" autocorrect="off"
            autocapitalize="off" spellcheck="false" readonly
            style="border: none; padding: 10px">
          </textarea>
        </dialog>
      </body>

      // Show text in textArea element.
      ShowText()
      {
        const className = "ClassName";
        const methodName = "MethodName()";
        const valueName = "text";
        const value = "This is the value.";
        const force = false;
        const textDialogID = "textDialog";
        const textAreaID = "textArea";
        LJC.ShowText(className, methodName, valueName, value, force, textDialogID
          , textAreaID);
      }

ToArray.summary: Copy collection items to an indexed array.

Visibility.param: The ID name for a specific HTMLElement.
"visible" to show the element, "hidden" to hide.

GetStartText.summary: Get the property list start text.

ShowProperties.summary: Show the properties of an object that are not null or "" and do not start with "on".

ShowSelectProperties.summary: Show selected properties of an object.
ShowSelectProperties.param: A string array of property names.
